meanings.definition: To allow access or participation after a previous ban.
meanings.sent1: The teacher unbanned the student from using the computer after a week.
meanings.sent2: The website unbanned the user who had violated the terms of service.
meanings.sent3: The library unbanned the noisy student, hoping for a quieter visit next time.
meanings.sent4: After apologizing, the player was unbanned from the game, ready to play again.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant unbanned the customer who had mistakenly been blacklisted, welcoming them back with a smile.

meanings.sent1: The unbanned book was finally available for checkout at the library.
meanings.sent2: The unbanned music festival attracted a large crowd of excited fans.
meanings.sent3: The unbanned candy brought joy to the children who had missed it during the ban.
meanings.sent4: The unbanned movie became a hit, drawing in audiences from all over.
meanings.sent5: The unbanned product flew off the shelves, proving its popularity among consumers.
